Heterogeneous Environment<!-- --> <span class="BottomRecommendation_count__4HpLo">(<!-- -->20<!-- -->)</span></h3><div class="BottomRecommendationContent_root__2qm4_"><div class="mobile-recs"><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_withBgOnHover__Tkyn2 SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="similarTo-card-description-0" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rgmai7d6:" popovertarget=":Rgmai7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rgmai7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/practical-incident-response-work-guide/63463855"><span class="sr-only">Practical Incident Response - Work Guide</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:0" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><div class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi"></div><div class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d"></div></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Practical Incident Response - Work Guide</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Practical Incident Response - Work Guide for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R7mgmai7d6:" popovertarget=":R7mgmai7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R7mgmai7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R7mgmai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R7mgmai7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/ciberseguridad">Eduardo Chavarro</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document provides an overview of practical malware triage and incident response. It discusses the process of analyzing unknown malware to determine if it is actually malware, what type of malware it is, and how to protect an organization from the threat. It describes common indicators of compromise and tools that can be used for both online and host-based malware triage and analysis. These include tools for dynamic analysis, memory forensics, and building your own analysis lab. The document also discusses indicators for ransomware and the process for responding to a ransomware incident, emphasizing prevention over reaction. Resources for further learning about digital forensics and incident response are also provided.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rgmai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rgmai7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_withBgOnHover__Tkyn2 SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="similarTo-card-description-1" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rh6ai7d6:" popovertarget=":Rh6ai7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rh6ai7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/EnergySec/fighting-malware-without-antivirus"><span class="sr-only">Fighting Malware Without Antivirus</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:1" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><div class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi"></div><div class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d"></div></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Fighting Malware Without Antivirus</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Fighting Malware Without Antivirus for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R7mh6ai7d6:" popovertarget=":R7mh6ai7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R7mh6ai7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R7mh6ai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R7mh6ai7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/EnergySec">EnergySec</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Jeff Bryner discusses the challenges of detecting malware without antivirus solutions, emphasizing the importance of Indicators of Compromise (IOCs) for identification and response. He highlights the limitations of current IOC tools and proposes a Python-based client/server system to facilitate efficient IOC deployment and detection. The document suggests an open source approach to enhance malware detection capabilities across various platforms.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rh6ai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rh6ai7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_withBgOnHover__Tkyn2 SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="similarTo-card-description-2" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rhmai7d6:" popovertarget=":Rhmai7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rhmai7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/openiocscan-ioc-scanner-for-memory-forensics/53962131"><span class="sr-only">openioc_scan - Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Fast and Generic Malware Triage Using openioc_scan Volatility Plugin for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R7mi6ai7d6:" popovertarget=":R7mi6ai7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R7mi6ai7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R7mi6ai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R7mi6ai7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/takahiroharuyama5">Takahiro Haruyama</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document describes a Volatility Framework plugin called openioc_scan that allows for fast and generic malware triage using open Indicators of Compromise (IOCs). The plugin supports OpenIOC 1.1 format files and can detect unknown threats based on generic malware traits like unusual executable paths, code injection, and hiding data in NTFS extended attributes. Some limitations include false positives and an inability to detect certain behaviors on 64-bit systems. Open source tools and generic IOCs are available for download to help analysts detect threats.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Ri6ai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Ri6ai7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_withBgOnHover__Tkyn2 SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="similarTo-card-description-4" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rimai7d6:" popovertarget=":Rimai7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rimai7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/security-analyst-workshop-20200212/227766780"><span class="sr-only">Security Analyst Workshop - It describes collecting data from firewalls, IDS/IPS, proxies, DNS logs, and system logs to detect suspicious activity. Once a potential malware sample is acquired, static and dynamic analysis techniques are used to analyze its behavior and identify indicators that can be used to detect infected machines, like created files, registry keys, and network traffic. These indicators are expressed using tools like Yara rules and Snort signatures to enable detection of the compromise across an environment.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rj6ai7d6:" It describes collecting data from firewalls, IDS/IPS, proxies, DNS logs, and system logs to detect suspicious activity. Once a potential malware sample is acquired, static and dynamic analysis techniques are used to analyze its behavior and identify indicators that can be used to detect infected machines, like created files, registry keys, and network traffic. aid in fast malware triage. It analyzes common malware like ZeuS, SpyEye, PoisonIvy, and ZeroAccess to identify useful IOCs like code injection signs, imported functions, obfuscated strings, and protocol-related strings. Generated IOCs are defined using the OpenIOC framework. While effective, OpenIOC has limitations and room for improvement through automation, open sourcing, and integrating with other specifications.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rkmai7d6:" SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document presents a method for detecting malware and rootkits using in-memory analysis and machine learning techniques. It outlines a two-phase approach where phase I employs static analysis for anomaly detection in memory artifacts, while phase II utilizes dynamic analysis to accurately classify benign versus malicious code. The objective is to automate the detection process efficiently and effectively, leveraging clustering algorithms and call trace analysis to identify advanced persistent threats in a scalable manner.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rl6ai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rl6ai7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document discusses digital forensics techniques for investigating incidents on Windows systems. It covers examining memory dumps, processes, services, drivers, ports, file systems, and other artifacts to determine what occurred. Specific techniques include comparing memory data to self-reported information and disk sources, identifying unknown files, examining auto-start points and jump lists, analyzing prefetch and event logs, and reviewing internet history and cache files. The goal is to discern how and when a system may have been compromised through analyzing changing system states and artifacts left by activities on the system.</span></div></div><div class="" SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document provides an overview of a game plan for analyzing malware. It will include a theoretical overview today followed by detailed presentations on virtualization, honeypots/honeynets, debugging, and more. It discusses setting up a controlled lab environment for analysis including static analysis, network traffic analysis, disk/file system analysis, and memory analysis. It also discusses various tools that can be used for each part of the analysis process.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Romai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Romai7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_withBgOnHover__Tkyn2 SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="similarTo-card-description-17" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rp6ai7d6:" popovertarget=":Rp6ai7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rp6ai7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/malware-analysis-1-for-null-mumbai-chapter-by-pp-singh/4672091"><span class="sr-only">&#x27;Malware Analysis&#x27; by PP Singh</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:17" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><div class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi"></div><div class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d"></div></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">&#x27;Malware Analysis&#x27; It discusses methodologies such as static and behavioral analysis, the importance of virtualization, and the use of specific tools and environments for effective malware research. The material emphasizes the complexities of modern malware and the necessity for automation and careful analysis to keep pace with evolving threats.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rp6ai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rp6ai7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R7mpmai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R7mpmai7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/richarddxd">richarddxd</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Patching and updating software is important to mitigate vulnerabilities. Regularly applying patches from vendors keeps systems secure by fixing known issues exploited by viruses, worms, and hackers. It is also important to monitor websites for the latest vulnerability information and use scanning tools to identify vulnerabilities on networks and hosts. Once found, vulnerabilities should be remediated by applying patches, changing configurations, or removing unauthorized access. Regular assessments help measure security controls and identify gaps.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rpmai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document discusses RSA Security&#x27;s use of the MITRE ATT&amp;CK framework for identifying tactics and techniques in cybersecurity, alongside the tools IDA Pro, BinDiff, and Diaphora for exploit detection and binary analysis. It emphasizes a process for comparing binary files to identify vulnerabilities, specifically highlighting a privilege escalation vulnerability (CVE-2023-29336) and providing insights on how to create a proof of concept for exploitation. Additionally, it includes demonstration videos showing how the exploit could be utilized in real-world scenarios.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R4mbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R4mbi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_withBgOnHover__Tkyn2 SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-1" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R56bi7d6:" popovertarget=":R56bi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R56bi7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/insert-coin-to-continue-ransomware-in-the-gaming-industrypdf/252837770"><span class="sr-only">Insert coin to continue - Ransomware in the gaming industry.pdf</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Insert coin to continue - Ransomware in the gaming industry.pdf for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1tl6bi7d6:" popovertarget=":R1tl6bi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1tl6bi7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R1tl6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1tl6bi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/StefanoMaccaglia">Stefano Maccaglia</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document details two ransomware attacks on the gaming industry, emphasizing the sophisticated techniques used by attackers, such as exploiting vulnerabilities in Exchange servers and utilizing webshells for credential harvesting. It highlights the importance of network visibility and the presence of enablers of compromise, such as outdated protocols and poor cybersecurity practices, which facilitated these attacks. Ultimately, the outcomes of these incidents underscore the need for improved cybersecurity measures and incident response strategies in the gaming sector.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R56bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R56bi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_withBgOnHover__Tkyn2 SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-2" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mbi7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mbi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mbi7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:2" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><div class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi"></div><div class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d"></div></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">From velvet to silk  there is still a lot of sweat</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save From velvet to silk  there is still a lot of sweat for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1tlmbi7d6:" popovertarget=":R1tlmbi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1tlmbi7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R1tlmbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1tlmbi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/StefanoMaccaglia">Stefano Maccaglia</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document provides an overview of fileless and living-off-the-land (LotL) attacks. It discusses how LotL attacks use legitimate system tools and functions rather than dropping files. Examples mentioned include using PowerShell scripts, macros, and registry entries to execute code. The document then describes a real-world ransomware attack attributed to the REvil group that impacted Kaseya software. The attack exploited a Kaseya server vulnerability to spread ransomware to Kaseya customers. It used living-off-the-land techniques like certutil.exe to download and execute a malicious payload without dropping files. The challenges with detecting and preventing fileless attacks are also summarized.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R5mbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mbi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_withBgOnHover__Tkyn2 SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-3" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R66bi7d6:" popovertarget=":R66bi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R66bi7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/un-presentation-10172018-maccaglia/119918662"><span class="sr-only">UN Presentation - 10-17-2018 - Maccaglia</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:3" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><div class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi"></div><div class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d"></div></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">UN Presentation - 10-17-2018 - Maccaglia</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save UN Presentation - 10-17-2018 - Maccaglia for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1tm6bi7d6:" popovertarget=":R1tm6bi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1tm6bi7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R1tm6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1tm6bi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/StefanoMaccaglia">Stefano Maccaglia</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document outlines the evolving landscape of cyber threats, emphasizing the rise of Advanced Persistent Threats (APTs) and their diverse attack methods that include cybercrime, cyberwarfare, and targeted strategic attacks. It discusses notable cybercriminal groups like the Lazarus Group and Carbanak, detailing their methods and targets while highlighting the significant risks associated with these organized operations. Recommendations for organizations and individuals on protecting against such threats include using modern cybersecurity technologies, training staff on recognizing cyber incidents, and following established protocols when facing potential breaches.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R66bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R66bi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_withBgOnHover__Tkyn2 SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-4" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R6mbi7d6:" popovertarget=":R6mbi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R6mbi7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/chasing-the-adder-a-tale-from-the-apt-world/98153807"><span class="sr-only">Chasing the Adder. A tale from the APT world...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:4" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><div class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi"></div><div class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d"></div></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Chasing the Adder. A tale from the APT world...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Chasing the Adder. A tale from the APT world... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1tmmbi7d6:" popovertarget=":R1tmmbi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1tmmbi7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R1tmmbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1tmmbi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/StefanoMaccaglia">Stefano Maccaglia</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document discusses the analysis of an attack involving a compromised website containing a PHP webshell. Additional artifacts found included an initial SQL injection, a China Chopper webshell, and a Golang-coded ss.exe backdoor. The attacker used a vulnerability in Sandboxie to evade detection and execute a debugsrv.exe trojan. Yara rules were provided to detect related malware samples. The investigation mapped the attacker&#x27;s lateral movement and a remediation plan was implemented over 35 days.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R6mbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R6mbi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_withBgOnHover__Tkyn2 SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-5" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R76bi7d6:" popovertarget=":R76bi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R76bi7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/dcc-2016-new-strategies-old-actors-apt-and-the-evolution-of-cybercriminal-world/59902124"><span class="sr-only">DCC 2016   New strategies, old actors - APT and the evolution of Cybercrimina...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:5" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><div class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi"></div><div class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d"></div></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">DCC 2016   New strategies, old actors - APT and the evolution of Cybercrimina...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save DCC 2016   New strategies, old actors - APT and the evolution of Cybercrimina... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1tn6bi7d6:" popovertarget=":R1tn6bi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1tn6bi7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R1tn6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1tn6bi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/StefanoMaccaglia">Stefano Maccaglia</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document discusses the evolving strategies of Advanced Persistent Threats (APTs) and their interactions with the cybercriminal world. It highlights the use of ATM malware and examines various case studies. The conclusion emphasizes the necessity of adapting security measures in response to these strategies.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R76bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R76bi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_withBgOnHover__Tkyn2 SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-6" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R7mbi7d6:" popovertarget=":R7mbi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R7mbi7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/maccaglia-cybercrime-un-approccio-tecnologico-e-sociologico/48807320"><span class="sr-only">Maccaglia - Cybercrime un approccio tecnologico e sociologico</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:6" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><div class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi"></div><div class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d"></div></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Maccaglia - Cybercrime un approccio tecnologico e sociologico</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Maccaglia - Cybercrime un approccio tecnologico e sociologico for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1tnmbi7d6:" popovertarget=":R1tnmbi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1tnmbi7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R1tnmbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1tnmbi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/StefanoMaccaglia">Stefano Maccaglia</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">La tesi di laurea di Stefano Maccaglia analizza il cybercrime attraverso un approccio sociologico e tecnologico, evidenziando la crescente criticità di questi fenomeni nel contesto globale. Il progetto propone lo sviluppo di un agente software basato su un algoritmo neurale per monitorare e segnalare anomalie nei sistemi informatici, mirando a prevenire attacchi informatici. Si discute anche l&#x27;importanza della sociologia nella comprensione dei comportamenti degli attaccanti e nella classificazione degli attacchi per migliorare le misure di sicurezza.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R7mbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R7mbi7d6"></div></div><div class="desktop-recs"><div Initiative: Building a Seamless Map of Hazardous Fu...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:1" class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">National Fuels Treatments Initiative: Building a Seamless Map of Hazardous Fu...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save National Fuels Treatments Initiative: Building a Seamless Map of Hazardous Fu... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R7mh6ci7d6:" popovertarget=":R7mh6ci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R7mh6ci7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R7mh6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R7mh6ci7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/SafeSoftware">Safe Software</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The National Fuels Treatments Initiative (NFT) is transforming wildfire mitigation by creating a standardized map of nationwide fuels treatment locations across all land ownerships in the United States. While existing state and federal systems capture this data in diverse formats, NFT bridges these gaps, delivering the first truly integrated national view. This dataset will be used to measure the implementation of the National Cohesive Wildland Strategy and demonstrate the positive impact of collective investments in hazardous fuels reduction nationwide. In Phase 1, we developed an ETL pipeline template in FME Form, leveraging a schema-agnostic workflow with dynamic feature handling intended for fast roll-out and light maintenance. This was key as the initiative scaled from a few to over fifty contributors nationwide. By directly pulling from agency data stores, oftentimes ArcGIS Feature Services, NFT preserves existing structures, minimizing preparation needs. External mapping tables ensure consistent attribute and domain alignment, while robust change detection processes keep data current and actionable. Now in Phase 2, we’re migrating pipelines to FME Flow to take advantage of advanced scheduling, monitoring dashboards, and automated notifications to streamline operations. Join us to explore how this initiative exemplifies the power of technology, blending FME, ArcGIS Online, and AWS to solve a national business problem with a scalable, automated solution.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rh6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rh6ci7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_withBgOnHover__Tkyn2 SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-2" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rhmci7d6:" popovertarget=":Rhmci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rhmci7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/safe-software-3dutility-solids-gerardo-boquin-pptx-1-pdf/280421743"><span class="sr-only">Integration of Utility Data into 3D BIM Models Using a 3D Solids Modeling Wor...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:2" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><div class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi"></div><div class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d"></div></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Integration of Utility Data into 3D BIM Models Using a 3D Solids Modeling Wor...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Integration of Utility Data into 3D BIM Models Using a 3D Solids Modeling Wor... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R7mhmci7d6:" popovertarget=":R7mhmci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R7mhmci7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R7mhmci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R7mhmci7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/SafeSoftware">Safe Software</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Jacobs has developed a 3D utility solids modelling workflow to improve the integration of utility data into 3D Building Information Modeling (BIM) environments. This workflow, a collaborative effort between the New Zealand Geospatial Team and the Australian Data Capture Team, employs FME to convert 2D utility data into detailed 3D representations, supporting enhanced spatial analysis and clash detection.

To enable the automation of this process, Jacobs has also developed a survey data standard that standardizes the capture of existing utilities. This standard ensures consistency in data collection, forming the foundation for the subsequent automated validation and modelling steps. The workflow begins with the acquisition of utility survey data, including attributes such as location, depth, diameter, and material of utility assets like pipes and manholes. This data is validated through a custom-built tool that ensures completeness and logical consistency, including checks for proper connectivity between network components. Following validation, the data is processed using an automated modelling tool to generate 3D solids from 2D geometric representations. These solids are then integrated into BIM models to facilitate compatibility with 3D workflows and enable detailed spatial analyses.

The workflow contributes to improved spatial understanding by visualizing the relationships between utilities and other infrastructure elements. The automation of validation and modeling processes ensures consistent and accurate outputs, minimizing errors and increasing workflow efficiency.

This methodology highlights the application of FME in addressing challenges associated with geospatial data transformation and demonstrates its utility in enhancing data integration within BIM frameworks. By enabling accurate 3D representation of utility networks, the workflow supports improved design collaboration and decision-making in complex infrastructure projects</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rhmci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rhmci7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" War_And_Cyber_3_Years_Of_Struggle_And_Lessons_For_Global_Security.pdf for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R7mi6ci7d6:" popovertarget=":R7mi6ci7d6:" class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R7mi6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R7mi6ci7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/biswajitbanerjee38">biswajitbanerjee38</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Russia is one of the most aggressive nations when it comes to state coordinated cyberattacks — and Ukraine has been at the center of their crosshairs for 3 years. This report, provided the State Service of Special Communications and Information Protection of Ukraine contains an incredible amount of cybersecurity insights, showcasing the coordinated aggressive cyberwarfare campaigns of Russia against Ukraine.

It brings to the forefront that understanding your adversary, especially an aggressive nation state, is important for cyber defense. Knowing their motivations, capabilities, and tactics becomes an advantage when allocating resources for maximum impact.

Intelligence shows Russia is on a cyber rampage, leveraging FSB, SVR, and GRU resources to professionally target Ukraine’s critical infrastructures, military, and international diplomacy support efforts.

The number of total incidents against Ukraine, originating from Russia, has steadily increased from 1350 in 2021 to 4315 in 2024, but the number of actual critical incidents has been managed down from a high of 1048 in 2022 to a mere 59 in 2024 — showcasing how the rapid detection and response to cyberattacks has been impacted by Ukraine’s improved cyber resilience.

Even against a much larger adversary, Ukraine is showcasing outstanding cybersecurity, enabled by strong strategies and sound tactics. There are lessons to learn for any enterprise that could potentially be targeted by aggressive nation states.

Definitely worth the read!</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Ri6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Ri6ci7d6"></div><div class="separator RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">מכונות CNC קידוח אנכיות הן הבחירה הנכונה והטובה ביותר לקידוח ארונות וארגזים לייצור רהיטים. החלק נוסע לאורך ציר ה-x באמצעות ציר SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Have you ever struggled to read a tiny label on a medicine box or tried to navigate a confusing website? Now imagine if every learning experience felt that way—every single day.

For millions of people living with disabilities, poorly designed content isn’t just frustrating. It’s a barrier to growth. Inclusive learning is about fixing that. And today, AI is helping us build digital learning that’s smarter, kinder, and accessible to everyone.

Accessible learning increases engagement, retention, performance, and inclusivity for everyone. Inclusive design is simply better design.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rk6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rk6ci7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_withBgOnHover__Tkyn2 SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-8" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rkmci7d6:" popovertarget=":Rkmci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rkmci7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/postgresql-extensions-development-in-rust-posette-2025-nttdata/280429555"><span class="sr-only">Can We Use Rust to Develop Extensions for PostgreSQL? RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The OpenACC organization focuses on enhancing parallel computing skills and advancing interoperability in scientific applications through hackathons and training. The upcoming 2025 Open Accelerated Computing Summit (OACS) aims to explore the convergence of AI and HPC in scientific computing and foster knowledge sharing. This year&#x27;s OACS welcomes talk submissions from a variety of topics, from Using Standard Language Parallelism to Computer Vision Applications. The document also highlights several open hackathons, a call to apply for NVIDIA Academic Grant Program and resources for optimizing scientific applications using OpenACC directives.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rl6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rl6ci7d6"></div><div class="separator href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/kubernetes-security-act-now-before-it-s-too-late-pptx/280343439"><span class="sr-only">Kubernetes Security Act Now Before It’s Too Late</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:10" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><div class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Kubernetes Security Act Now Before It’s Too Late</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Kubernetes Security Act Now Before It’s Too Late for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R7mlmci7d6:" popovertarget=":R7mlmci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R7mlmci7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R7mlmci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R7mlmci7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/ultimatesecpro">Michael Furman</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">In today&#x27;s cloud-native landscape, Kubernetes has become the de facto standard for orchestrating containerized applications, but its inherent complexity introduces unique security challenges. Are you one YAML away from disaster?

This  presentation, &quot;Kubernetes Security: Act Now Before It’s Too Late,&quot; is your essential guide to understanding and mitigating the critical security risks within your Kubernetes environments. This presentation dives deep into the OWASP Kubernetes Top Ten, providing actionable insights to harden your clusters.

We will cover:

The fundamental architecture of Kubernetes and why its security is paramount.
In-depth strategies for protecting your Kubernetes Control Plane, including kube-apiserver and etcd.
Crucial best practices for securing your workloads and nodes, covering topics like privileged containers, root filesystem security, and the essential role of Pod Security Admission.

Don&#x27;t wait for a breach. Learn how to identify, prevent, and respond to Kubernetes security threats effectively.
It&#x27;s time to act now before it&#x27;s too late!</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rlmci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rlmci7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save “From Enterprise to Makers: Driving Vision AI Innovation at the Extreme Edge,... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R7mm6ci7d6:" popovertarget=":R7mm6ci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R7mm6ci7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R7mm6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R7mm6ci7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/embeddedvision">Edge AI and Vision Alliance</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">For the full video of this presentation, please visit: https://www.edge-ai-vision.com/2025/06/from-enterprise-to-makers-driving-vision-ai-innovation-at-the-extreme-edge-a-presentation-from-sony-semiconductor-solutions/

Amir Servi, Edge Deep Learning Product Manager at Sony Semiconductor Solutions, presents the “From Enterprise to Makers: Driving Vision AI Innovation at the Extreme Edge” tutorial at the May 2025 Embedded Vision Summit.

Sony’s unique integrated sensor-processor technology is enabling ultra-efficient intelligence directly at the image source, transforming vision AI for enterprises and developers alike. In this presentation, Servi showcases how the AITRIOS platform simplifies vision AI for enterprises with tools for large-scale deployments and model management.

Servi also highlights his company’s collaboration with Ultralytics and Raspberry Pi, which brings YOLO models to the developer community, empowering grassroots innovation. Whether you’re scaling vision AI for industry or experimenting with cutting-edge tools, this presentation will demonstrate how Sony is accelerating high-performance, energy-efficient vision AI for all.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rm6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rm6ci7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_withBgOnHover__Tkyn2 SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-12" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rmmci7d6:" popovertarget=":Rmmci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rmmci7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/ai-vs-human-writing-can-you-tell-the-difference/280634408"><span class="sr-only">AI vs Human Writing: Can You Tell the Difference?</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:12" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><div class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi"></div><div class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d"></div></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">AI vs Human Writing: Can You Tell the Difference?</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save AI vs Human Writing: Can You Tell the Difference? for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R7mmmci7d6:" popovertarget=":R7mmmci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R7mmmci7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R7mmmci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R7mmmci7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/ShashiSathyanarayana">Shashi Sathyanarayana, Ph.D</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This slide illustrates a side-by-side comparison between human-written, AI-written, and ambiguous content. It highlights subtle cues that help readers assess authenticity, raising essential questions about the future of communication, trust, and thought leadership in the age of generative AI.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rmmci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rmmci7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R7mn6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R7mn6ci7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/SafeSoftware">Safe Software</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Have-a-skate-with-Bob (HASB-KC) is a local charity that holds two Hockey Tournaments every year to raise money in the fight against Pancreatic Cancer. The FME Form software is used to integrate and exchange data via API, between Google Forms, Google Sheets, Stripe payments, SmartWaiver, and the GoDaddy email marketing tools to build a grass-roots Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system for the charity. The CRM is used to communicate effectively and readily with the participants of the hockey events and most importantly the local area sponsors of the event. Communication consists of a BLOG used to inform participants of event details including, the ever-important team rosters. Funds raised by these events are used to support families in the local area to fight cancer and support PanCan research efforts to find a cure against this insidious disease. FME Form removes the tedium and error-prone manual ETL processes against these systems into 1 or 2 workbenches that put the data needed at the fingertips of the event organizers daily freeing them to work on outreach and marketing of the events in the community.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rn6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rn6ci7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div aria-describedby="latest-card-description-15" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Ro6ci7d6:" popovertarget=":Ro6ci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Ro6ci7d6"><a Digital Transformation with FME</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:15" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><div slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Supporting the NextGen 911 Digital Transformation with FME</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Supporting the NextGen 911 Digital Transformation with FME for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R7mo6ci7d6:" popovertarget=":R7mo6ci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R7mo6ci7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R7mo6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R7mo6ci7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/SafeSoftware">Safe Software</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Next Generation 911 involves the transformation of our 911 system from an old analog one to the new digital internet based architecture. The evolution of NG911 opens up a host of new opportunities to improve the system. This includes everything from device based location,  to real time text. This can improve location accuracy dramatically as well as provide live updates from the citizen in need along with real time sensor updates. There is also the opportunity to provide multi-media attachments and medical records if the end user approves. This digital transformation and enhancements all require the support of new NENA and CRTC standards, along with integration across a variety of data streams. 

This presentation will focus on how FME has supported NG911 transformations to date, and how we are positioning FME to support the enhanced capabilities to come. This session will be of interest to emergency services, municipalities and anyone who may be interested to know more about how emergency services are being improved to provide more accurate, localized information in order to improve the speed and relevance of emergency response and ultimately save more lives and provide better outcomes for those in need.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Ro6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Ro6ci7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" Workspaces following the OGC API Processes specification. Additionally, it enhances security and user management by supporting OAuth2 authentication. Join us to discover how these advancements can elevate your enterprise integration workflows and ensure seamless, secure interactions with FME Flow.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Romci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Romci7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_withBgOnHover__Tkyn2 SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-17" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rp6ci7d6:" popovertarget=":Rp6ci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rp6ci7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crypto-super-500-14th-report-june2025-pdf/280478944"><span class="sr-only">Crypto Super 500 - The report focuses on Proof-of-Work cryptocurrencies since those use substantial supercomputer power to mint new coins and encode transactions on their blockchains. Only two make the cut this time, Bitcoin with $18 billion of annual economic value produced and Dogecoin with $1 billion. Bitcoin has now reached the Zettascale with typical hash rates of 0.9 Zettahashes per second. Bitcoin is powered by the world&#x27;s largest decentralized supercomputer in a continuous winner take all lottery incentive network.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rp6ci7d6:" popover="auto" Cao.pdf</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:16 / 9;--index:19" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><div Yixuan Cao.pdf</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button" data-testid="button"
